channel.title: android on Yen's blog
channel.description: Recent content in android on Yen's blog

item.title: How to not upgrade the Nexus 7 to Lollipop
item.description: I have a first-generation Nexus 7 tablet made by Asus which ran KitKat 4.4. When the OTA Lollipop update became available, I couldn’t wait to install it. The latest and greatest Android running on Google hardware seemed to be a match made in heaven; it would be better, prettier and faster, right? As you can probably guess from the title of this post, the answer was a resounding no. Everything became sluggish, swipes would only registered after a couple of seconds, random things popped open and close.

item.title: Upgrading the HTC Aria with Android Gingerbread and CyanogenMod
item.description: I have an HTC Aria which runs now-ancient Android 2.1. This phone is far from being the latest and greatest, to put it mildly, but I like its small form factor. After putting up with it for a year, I have had enough and decided to upgrade it to Gingerbread. This is how I did it. As this is my first attempt, no doubt there are different and better ways to do things.
